README.md

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 # QUEST
00002 
00003 A library for simulating operations on sets of qubits. 
00004 
00005 Operations implemented:
00006 * Rotations of a single qubit
00007 * TODO: Measure if a single qubit is in the zero state
00008 * TODO: Two qubit phase gate
00009 
00010 ## Getting started
00011 
00012 With git: clone the root directory to your device
00013 
00014 git clone https://github.com/aniabrown/QUEST.git [QUESTHOME]
00015 
00016 Without git: download the directory manually
00017 
00018 'Clone or download' > 'Download zip'
00019 
00020 In the root directory, run a simple 8 qubit example on one node:
00021 
00022 The default compiler is the gnu compiler. To change to the intell compiler, edit the COMMON CONFIG section at the beginning of makefile in the root directory. Change COMPILER=GNU to COMPILER=INTEL. Then run:
00023 
00024 ```
00025 make clean
00026 make
00027 ./demo 8
00028 ```
00029 
00030 This will report some information about the size of the system, perform rotations and verify that
00031 the state vector of probability amplitudes is still normalized. 
00032 
00033 OpenMP is enabled by default. To change the number of threads used by the program, set the value of OMP_NUM_THREADS before running the program, eg export OMP_NUM_THREADS=16. See examples/ompJob.sh for an example of how to do this in a job submission script.
00034 
00035 ## Building other examples
00036 
00037 There are other examples of codes using the QUEST library in the examples folder. To use one of these,
00038 copy from the examples folder into the root folder, eg:
00039 cp examples/timingDemo.c timingDemo.c
00040 
00041 Edit the COMMON CONFIG section at the beginning of makefile. Change MY_FILE_NAME to the name of the file without
00042 any extension, eg MY_FILE_NAME=timingDemo 
00043 
00044 Change the name of the executable as desired eg EXE=myProg.
00045 
00046 Run with:
00047 ```
00048 make clean
00049 make
00050 ./myProg [NUMBER OF QUBITS] 
00051 ```
00052 To run on arcus-b on one node, use the job submission script examples/ompJob.sh
00053 
00054 ## Creating a new file from the template
00055 
00056 The initial example file available in the root folder is the template file basicTemplate.c. If you have removed
00057 this file, it is also available in examples/basicTemplate.c. The structure of this file is:
00058 
00059 ```
00060 Initialisation
00061 Rotations
00062 Measurement
00063 2 Qubit phase gate
00064 Cleanup 
00065 ```
00066 
00067 In general, leave the initialization and cleanup sections and edit the rotations, measurement and phase gate
00068 sections. Further explanations are in the template file. The full list of QUEST library functions that can be used here is listed in qubits.h. 
00069 
00070 ## Multi node code
00071 
00072 To run over several nodes with MPI, edit the COMMON CONFIG section at the beginning of makefile. 
00073 
00074 Change USE_MPI=0 to USE_MPI=1.
00075 
00076 Run with:
00077 ```
00078 make clean
00079 make
00080 mpirun -np [NUMBER OF PROCESSES] ./demo [NUMBER OF QUBITS]
00081 ```
00082 To run on arcus-b, use the job submission script examples/mpiJob.sh
00083 
00084 Note that the API to the QUEST library is unchanged when running on multiple nodes. The template file basicTemplate.c
00085 is valid for both single and multi node environments. 
00086 
00087 ## API Documentation
00088 
00089 Copy Doxygen_doc/html to a device with an internet browser. Open Doxygen_doc/html/index.html. Otherwise, a pdf copy
00090 is available at Doxygen_doc/latex/refman.pdf
00091
